messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] invasion of korea in 1592
messages.msgSnippet: Dear group: In the following link, you can find an image of book, A Lecuture on a History of the Japanese Empire Sea Power and a picture of an ironclad ship
messages.messageBody:
Dear group:
In the following link, you can find an image of book,
"A Lecuture on a History of the Japanese Empire Sea
Power" and a picture of an ironclad ship in the book,
which the Japanese Navy built under a direct order of
Toyotomi Hideyoshi after numerous loss of the Japanese
naval ships from encounters with the Korean ironclad
ship, Turtle ship during the Imjin war.
It is the first time that I saw this, too.

http://www.dkbnews.com/bbs/view.php?id=bizzarre&no=1887

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] invasion of korea in 1592
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for posting the information.  I tried to access the website but it froze my computer. Do you have any information on the composition of the forces?  I d
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for posting the information. I tried to access the website but it
froze my computer.

Do you have any information on the composition of the forces? I'd love to
find out the ratio between cavalry and infantry. I'd also like to find a
breakdown for the infantry (eg. how many Samurai, how many Ashigaru, if any of the
Ashigaru had arquebusses, or if they were all armed with bows, etc.).

Thanks in advance.

Bob Burke

In a message dated 5/1/05 9:05:53 PM, 004040@... writes:

<< OLIVERIO Christophe wrote:


>Thanks for your response, but I look the

>http://www.samurai-archives.com but there is not

>any battle order for japanese army of the invasion of

>korea in 1592

>

>if I can reformule my demand, I want the detail of the

>troops in the invasion army of the korea :

>the generals, the number and kind of every units

>( samurais, ashigaru, servants ... )

>

>books or url links can be the answer

>

>thanks

>

>

>

Involved Daimyous and number of mobilized soldiers


"Bunroku no Eki" (1592)


1st corps:18700

Yukinaga KONOSHI, Yoshitosi SOU, Shigenobu MATSURA,

Harunobu ARIMA, Yoshiaki OOMURA, Sumiharu GOTOU


2nd corps:22800

Kiyomasa KATOU, Naoshige NABESHIMA, Yorifusa SAGARA


3rd corps:11000

Nagamasa KURODA, Yoshimune OOTOMO


4th corps:14000

Yoshimari MOURI, Yoshihiro SHIMADZU, Suketaka ITOU,

Tadatoyo SHIMADZU


5th corps:25100

Masanori FUKUSHIMA, Motochika CHOUSOKABE, Iemasa HACHISUKA

Chikanari IKOMA, Michiyuki KOJIMA


6th corps:15700

Takakage KOBAYAKAWA, Hidekane KOBAYAKAWA (aka MOURI),

Munesgige TACHIBANA


7th corps:30000

Terumoto MOURI


8th corps:10000

Hideie UKITA


9th corps:11500

Hidekatsu HASHIBA, Tadaoki NAGAOKA (aka HOSOKAWA)



Sum:158800



"Keichou no Eki" (1597)


1st corps:10000

Kiyomasa KATOU


2nd corps:14700

Yukinaga KONISHI, Yoshitoshi SOU


3rd corps:10000

Nagamasa KURODA


4th corps:12000

Naoshige NABESHIMA


5th corps:10000

Yoshihiro SHIMADZU


6th corps:13200

Yoshiaki KATOU


7th corps:11000

Iemasa HACHISUKA


8th corps:40000

Hidemoto MOURI, Hideie UKITA


'Pusanpo' castle garrison:10307

Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA


'Angolpo' castle garrison:5000

Muneshige TACHIBANA


'Kadok' castle garrison:1000

Naotsugu TAKAHASI


'Chookto' castle garrison:1000

Hidekane KOBAYAKAWA


'Seosengpo' castle garrison:3000

Yoshinaga ASANO


Sum:141390



*Reference: "Bunroku / Keichou no Eki" in Japanese Wikipedia

http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%96%87%E7%A6%84%E3%81%AE%E5%BD%B9






---

>Thanks for your response, but I look the

>
Involved Daimyous and number of mobilized soldiers

"Bunroku no Eki" (1592)

1st corps:18700
Yukinaga KONOSHI, Yoshitosi SOU, Shigenobu MATSURA,
Harunobu ARIMA, Yoshiaki OOMURA, Sumiharu GOTOU

2nd corps:22800
Kiyomasa KATOU, Naoshige NABESHIMA, Yorifusa SAGARA

3rd corps:11000
Nagamasa KURODA, Yoshimune OOTOMO

4th corps:14000
Yoshimari MOURI, Yoshihiro SHIMADZU, Suketaka ITOU,
Tadatoyo SHIMADZU

5th corps:25100
Masanori FUKUSHIMA, Motochika CHOUSOKABE, Iemasa HACHISUKA
Chikanari IKOMA, Michiyuki KOJIMA

6th corps:15700
Takakage KOBAYAKAWA, Hidekane KOBAYAKAWA (aka MOURI),
Munesgige TACHIBANA

7th corps:30000
Terumoto MOURI

8th corps:10000
Hideie UKITA

9th corps:11500
Hidekatsu HASHIBA, Tadaoki NAGAOKA (aka HOSOKAWA)

Sum:158800


"Keichou no Eki" (1597)

1st corps:10000
Kiyomasa KATOU

2nd corps:14700
Yukinaga KONISHI, Yoshitoshi SOU

3rd corps:10000
Nagamasa KURODA

4th corps:12000
Naoshige NABESHIMA

5th corps:10000
Yoshihiro SHIMADZU

6th corps:13200
Yoshiaki KATOU

7th corps:11000
Iemasa HACHISUKA

8th corps:40000
Hidemoto MOURI, Hideie UKITA

'Pusanpo' castle garrison:10307
Hideaki KOBAYAKAWA

'Angolpo' castle garrison:5000
Muneshige TACHIBANA

'Kadok' castle garrison:1000
Naotsugu TAKAHASI

'Chookto' castle garrison:1000
Hidekane KOBAYAKAWA

'Seosengpo' castle garrison:3000
Yoshinaga ASANO

Sum:141390


*Reference: "Bunroku / Keichou no Eki" in Japanese Wikipedia
http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%96%87%E7%A6%84%E3%81%AE%E5%BD%B9

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] invasion of korea in 1592
messages.msgSnippet: ... The Ming Celestial Army that pushed down the Japanese was -according to sources- 300,000. Again, this might seem a bit exaggerate, but Chinese armies were
messages.messageBody:
On Apr 30, 2005, at 12:52 PM, burker1@... wrote:

> Ovliverio
>
> You can check the group's files. I've posted a copy of my
> bibliography
> for the Japanese Invasion of Korea there. So far, I haven't found an
> OB for
> the Japanese in Korea. The closest I've found is an article that says
> that the
> initial Japanese force nubmered around 200,000 men (seems high to me).
>
> If you find a breakdown of the Japanese forces, please let me know.
>
> Bob Burke

The Ming Celestial Army that pushed down the Japanese was -according to
sources- 300,000. Again, this might seem a bit exaggerate, but Chinese
armies were huge. It is an accepted theory that the military effort in
Korea was one of the reason for the upcoming fall of the Ming...
However, let's keep it between us, before the Chinese ask Koizumi to
pay for that... ;o)

cepo

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] invasion of korea in 1592
messages.msgSnippet: Ovliverio You can check the group s files.  I ve posted a copy of my bibliography for the Japanese Invasion of Korea there.  So far, I haven t found an OB for
messages.messageBody:
Ovliverio

You can check the group's files. I've posted a copy of my bibliography
for the Japanese Invasion of Korea there. So far, I haven't found an OB for
the Japanese in Korea. The closest I've found is an article that says that the
initial Japanese force nubmered around 200,000 men (seems high to me).

If you find a breakdown of the Japanese forces, please let me know.

Bob Burke

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] invasion of korea in 1592
messages.msgSnippet: ... I guess the Elisonian s article on the Cambridge History of Japan vol.4 or Turnbull s Samurai Invasion should have the most information on this topic,
messages.messageBody:
On Apr 27, 2005, at 5:00 AM, OLIVERIO Christophe wrote:

> if I can reformule my demand, I want the detail of the
> troops in the invasion army of the korea :
> the generals, the number and kind of every units
> ( samurais, ashigaru, servants ... )

I guess the Elisonian's article on the Cambridge History of Japan vol.4
or Turnbull's "Samurai Invasion" should have the most information on
this topic, but I am not sure they have detailed numbers. And remember
that Turnbull is seen by many as a amateurish historian.

cepo

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] invasion of korea in 1592
messages.msgSnippet: Look again in the samurai history archives homepage there you will find a section about articles one of them says Hideyoshi and Korea. Good Luck OLIVERIO
messages.messageBody:
Look again in the samurai history archives homepage there you will find a section about articles one of them says Hideyoshi and Korea.
Good Luck

OLIVERIO Christophe <c_oliverio@...> wrote:

Thanks for your response, but I look the
http://www.samurai-archives.com but there is not
any battle order for japanese army of the invasion of
korea in 1592

if I can reformule my demand, I want the detail of the
troops in the invasion army of the korea :
the generals, the number and kind of every units
( samurais, ashigaru, servants ... )

books or url links can be the answer

thanks

> Just look in the samurai archives homepage.
>
> C_OLIVERIO <c_oliverio@...> wrote:
>
> Hye
>
> I am searching the order of battle of the samourai
> army in 1592 korea
> invasion
>
> any one have this ? or if not exact order of battle
> some infos or links

>
> thanks
